transcript:
Therapist: You've made some great insights today, Priya. I'm impressed by your willingness to challenge perfectionism and prioritize self-care, even when it feels difficult. Remember, progress isn't always linear, and there will be ups and downs along the way. The important thing is that you're taking steps in the right direction and developing new habits to support your mental health and well-being.

Patient: Thank you, Nova. I know it won't be easy, but I'm committed to making these changes. I appreciate your guidance and support throughout this process.

Therapist: Before we wrap up today's session, I want to check in on your current mood and see if you have any final thoughts or questions.

Patient: I'm feeling a bit overwhelmed, but also hopeful. It's comforting to know that I have strategies to work on and that I'm not alone in this journey. I don't have any specific questions right now, but I'm sure I'll think of some as I continue to practice these techniques.

Therapist: It's completely normal to feel overwhelmed at times, especially when you're challenging long-held beliefs and patterns. Remember to be patient and compassionate with yourself, and don't hesitate to reach out for support when needed.

For homework this week, I'd like you to continue working on your thought records, focusing on challenging perfectionism and looking for evidence that contradicts your negative thoughts. Aim to complete at least one thought record per day and bring them to our next session for review.

I also encourage you to practice scheduled relaxation by setting aside dedicated time for painting or other self-care activities. Try to communicate your boundaries with colleagues and remind yourself that taking time for yourself is essential for your well-being.

Finally, continue practicing the "double standard" technique whenever you catch yourself being overly critical or setting unrealistic standards for yourself. Remind yourself that you deserve the same compassion and understanding you would offer to a friend.

Patient: That sounds like a good plan. I'll do my best to complete the thought records and practice scheduled relaxation and the "double standard" technique. Thank you for your support and guidance, Nova.

Therapist: You're welcome, Priya. I'm here to support you every step of the way. Remember, progress takes time, and every small step counts. I'm proud of the work you're doing, and I'm confident that with continued practice, you'll start to notice positive changes in your thoughts, feelings, and behaviors.

Let's plan to meet again next week to review your thought records and discuss your experiences with the techniques we've covered today. In the meantime, don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions or concerns.

Session Summary:
- Main topics discussed:
  - Challenging perfectionism and setting realistic standards
  - Prioritizing self-care and scheduled relaxation
  - Reframing negative thoughts using the "double standard" technique
- Techniques or exercises used:
  - Thought records (continued from previous sessions): Priya will continue using thought records to challenge negative thoughts related to perfectionism and self-worth. Plan to review thought records in the next session.
  - Self-compassion break (continued from previous sessions): Priya will practice offering herself kindness and understanding when perfectionistic thoughts arise. Plan to continue practicing this technique and discuss experiences in the next session.
  - Behavioral activation (continued from previous sessions): Priya will set aside time for painting as a form of self-care and engage in activities that bring joy and relaxation. Plan to monitor progress and discuss any challenges or successes in the next session.
  - Deep breathing exercise (introduced in a previous session): Priya will practice deep breathing when feeling stressed or overwhelmed, focusing on the sensation of the breath entering and leaving the body. Plan to continue practicing this technique and discuss experiences in the next session.
  - Scheduled relaxation (introduced in this session): Priya will intentionally schedule time for self-care activities, such as painting, and communicate boundaries with colleagues. Plan to discuss experiences and challenges with implementing this technique in the next session.
  - "Double standard" technique (introduced in this session): Priya will practice extending the same compassion and understanding to herself that she would offer to a friend when challenging perfectionistic thoughts. Plan to discuss experiences and insights gained from using this technique in the next session.
- Homework assigned:
  - Continue keeping thought records, focusing on challenging negative thoughts related to perfectionism and self-worth. Aim to complete at least one thought record per day and bring them to the next session for review.
  - Practice scheduled relaxation by setting aside dedicated time for painting or other self-care activities. Communicate boundaries with colleagues and remind yourself that taking time for yourself is essential for your well-being.
  - Continue practicing the "double standard" technique whenever you catch yourself being overly critical or setting unrealistic standards for yourself. Remind yourself that you deserve the same compassion and understanding you would offer to a friend.
- Patient's progress, challenges, depression symptoms, and important personal details:
  - Priya is making progress in recognizing the role of perfectionism in contributing to her stress and negative thoughts. She is practicing setting realistic goals and engaging in self-care activities like painting. Depressive symptoms, including sleep disturbances, fatigue, and feelings of worthlessness, persist but have shown some improvement. Priya's cultural background and religious beliefs are important to her, but she also faces stigma around mental health in her community.
- Core beliefs and intermediate beliefs: Not discussed in this session.
- Important information to carry forward:
  - Priya's thought records, progress with challenging perfectionism, and experiences with self-care and scheduled relaxation will be reviewed in the next session. Continue to explore the connection between thoughts, feelings, and behaviors, and work on developing additional coping strategies. Monitor progress with behavioral activation goals related to painting and self-care, as well as efforts to set realistic goals. In the next session, continue to focus on stress management techniques, challenging perfectionism, and reframing negative thoughts.
- Plan for the next session:
  - Review Priya's thought records and discuss any insights or challenges encountered with challenging perfectionism and setting realistic goals.
  - Check in on progress with self-care activities, such as painting, and discuss any changes in mood or stress levels.
  - Explore Priya's experiences with scheduled relaxation and the "double standard" technique, addressing any challenges or successes.
  - Discuss any adjustments needed to the treatment plan based on Priya's experiences and progress.
  - Begin exploring underlying beliefs that may contribute to perfectionism and negative self-talk, working on reframing these beliefs in a more balanced and compassionate way.
